ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
ygData.msgSnippet: Nice :) But the prob is I often only have 40 mins or so to play, time enough to kill 5 or 6 things solo but groups seldom want anyone for that long =/
ygData.messageBody:
Nice :) But the prob is I often only have 40 mins or so to play, time enough
to kill 5 or 6 things solo but groups seldom want anyone for that long =/



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cyr, Thierry [mailto:thierry.cyr@...]
> Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 8:23 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
>
>
> easy spot to get a group in the mornings and kickass xp
> halana is Velks. I
> have no prob at all to get groups there in the mornings
> before work. You
> can easily get a blue an hour in 54 at the frenzie camp there
> with a good
> puller or 2
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
> Sent: August 24, 2001 9:56 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
>
>
> I agree with an earlier response that soloing is NOT the
> determination of an
> overpowered class. I've lately taken to playing in groups on
> the weekends
> and soloing in the mornings during the week. I have soloed
> (and easily I
> might add) through 54, where I am now. At one point I was a
> twink with
> overpowered equip but I dont think thats true anymore.
>
> 51-54 I've been in Burningwood :) Its very nice here.. fear
> kiting or dot
> kiting, its up to you :)
>
> Halana/Tani
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Christopher Sanders [mailto:christopher.sanders@...]
> > Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 6:43 AM
> > To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
> >
> >
> > Seems to me, we solo well for certain level ranges.
> >
> > First, the early levels. Next would be our first charm song.
> > Next would be
> > where I am now. 39, and I can solo nearly any blue or black, with
> > patience, using chains and my 2 chants, with drums equipped.
> > Which is nice
> > when you get an add. :)
> >
> > In GD, it's sometimes hard to find a group, so it's nice to
> > once again have
> > the option of soloing until I can get one.
> >
> > Atonal
> >
> > PS - Our SK's tank Velketor. :)
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Blitz Krieg [mailto:blitz_krieg@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, August 23, 2001 8:05 PM
> > To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
> >
> >
> > I'm in total agreement. I can't speak for solo play, but in
> > group play we
> > simply kick ass. Even on raids, with the right guild that
> > knows how to use
> > us, we're no slouches. Thott throws out a lot of numbers
> > about how we don't
> > scale well as we level, but somehow his analysis doesn't mirror my
> > experiences on a daily basis.
> >
> > Hopefully VI is just looking at "stacking issues" and not
> > anything more
> > grand. :)
> >
> > Darkfox
> > Xegony
> >
> >
> >
> > Ugh....
> > Its funny... the more I play my bard and the higher she
> gets, I find
> > myself
> > sometimes not telling people everything I can do, kind of
> > keeping a low
> > profile, hoping that they don't notice. Seriously, don't
> > laugh, its just
> > that bards seem very overpowered to me at higher levels,
> > then again 60
> > shaman with Can IV.... I used to think all level 60 were
> > equally powerful
> > but I'm changing my thoughts. I hope nobody else
> figures this out!
> >
> > Tani, 54 Bardette
> > Halana, 60 Shaman
> > Solusek Ro
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
> >
> >
